verses.verse: How have you helped <WH5826> him that is without power <WH3581>? how save <WH3467> you the arm <WH2220> that has no <WH3808> strength <WH5797>?
How have you counseled <WH3289> him that has no <WH3808> wisdom <WH2451>? and how have you plentifully <WH7230> declared <WH3045> the thing as it is <WH8454>?
To whom have you uttered <WH5046> words <WH4405>? and whose spirit <WH5397> came from you <WH3318>?
Dead <WH7496> things are formed <WH2342> from under the waters <WH4325>, and the inhabitants there <WH7931>.
Hell <WH7585> is naked <WH6174> before him <WH11>, and destruction has no covering <WH3682>.
He stretches out <WH5186> the north <WH6828> over the empty place <WH8414>, and hangs <WH8518> the earth <WH776> upon nothing <WH1099>.
He binds up <WH6887> the waters <WH4325> in his thick clouds <WH5645>; and the cloud <WH6051> is not torn under them <WH1234>.
He holds back <WH270> the face <WH6440> of his throne <WH3678>, and spreads <WH6576> his cloud upon it <WH6051>.
He has surrounded <WH2328> the waters <WH6440> with bounds <WH2706>, until the day <WH216> and night <WH2822> come to an end <WH8503>.
The pillars <WH5982> of heaven <WH8064> tremble <WH7322> and are astonished <WH8539> at his reproof <WH1606>.
He divides <WH7280> the sea <WH3220> with his power <WH3581>, and by his understanding <WH8394> he strikes <WH4272> through the proud <WH7293>.
By his spirit <WH7307> he has garnished <WH8235> the heavens <WH8064>; his hand <WH3027> has formed <WH2342> the crooked <WH1281> serpent <WH5175>.
Behold <WH7098>, these are parts of his ways <WH1870>: but how little <WH8102> a portion <WH1697> is heard <WH8085> of him <WH7482>? but the thunder of his power <WH1369> who can understand <WH995>?
